pr_title: Fix Builder trying to break water

timeline.message: Start implementing improved water handling for the builder

Move fluid detection to its own build phase

also change fluid removal

timeline.bodyText: that needs to be properly formatted and needs javadoc, same thing for the next method.
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText:
Javadoc: yes, i missed that.
formatting: what is wrong with the formatting? i tried to make it like everything else.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: the bracket is on the new line
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: it was like that in clearStep so i kept it like that, or did you mean they should all get moved to a new line?
replies.author: ToMe25
Raycoms

replies.bodyText: if that is in clear step then someone messed that one up (can you please put it on a new line for cleanStep too?)

timeline.bodyText: this needs to be stored in the building class and serialized/deserialized so that it works on restart midway
timeline.author: Raycoms

      */

+    /**

replies.bodyText: OK i will do that.

replies.bodyText: I have tried implementing this, but as i can due to the game crashing when i try to load a world with a working builder(in the dev env only) i can't test it, so i just hope it works.

replies.bodyText: game crashing on startup of the world?
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: In dev mode it should crash less not more =D
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText:
yes, when i load a world in the dev env and there is a builder in it the game crashes.
i did post that on discord some time in the past(with log), i just didn't make an issue for it because its only in the dev env.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: can you send this to me (via pm)?

timeline.bodyText: I think we only need fluid detect, fluid remove is independent of block progress. (It's basically while list is not empty, return same state).
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: I didn't know the step would work without this, so i left it there, i will remove it then.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: you make it a normal state (like the completion state) with the if (list.hasElements ) return getState(). else return Completion (last state)
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: I did this.
replies.author: ToMe25

timeline.message:
Some Fixes

Remove Fluid_Detect build stage
Serialize/Deserialize fluidsToRemove

timeline.bodyText: this should be a ordered list.
timeline.author: Raycoms

      */

+    /**
+     * all the fluids to be removed in fluids_remove.
+     */

replies.bodyText:
earlier you told me to make it an ordered map, however i forgot that and made it a tree map.
what should i make it, ordered map, or list?
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText:
what type of map/list should this be?
java has neither a OrderedMap nor a OrderedList.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: LinkedHashMap
replies.author: Raycoms

timeline.message:
small changed

Move Spawn build phase to be executed last
Move NBT Tag names to NbtTagConstants
Make builder remove non-source blocks too

Fix switchStage not getting called

also sort the AITarget constructors
Fix workers taking very long to finish remove stage
